DOC.brief_summary: This study examine diet partner affect weight loss , diet adherence , psychological well-being , cortisol .
DOC.detailed_description: The goal study understand different type diet `` buddy system '' affect diet success outcomes related dieting . Pairs non-romantic cohabit female dyad ( i.e . roommate ) randomly assign one follow three-week manipulation : ( ) neither roommate diet , ( b ) one roommate assign 1200-calorie/day diet ate normally , ( c ) roommates assigned 1200-calorie/day diet . Both pre- post diet , participant weight measure , fill psychological questionnaire , provide two day diurnal salivary cortisol sample . During three-week manipulation period , participant assign diet recorded calorie consume day . This study test whether diet pair would lead improved diet outcome term adherence weight loss , change psychological well-being , change cortisol .
DOC.criteria: Female Over 18 year age Interested diet come 12 month selfreported BMI 18.5 < 5 kg weight change previous 3 month Have university meal plan Have roommate also willing/eligible participate Recent/current history major medical disorder Pregnancy/lactation History eat disorder Use lipidlowering medication Use weightaltering/metabolismaltering medication Smoking
